slidelink.displaytext: Arrangement of Food, Water and Snacks
Identification of New or Inexperienced Workers
Selection of users who can Use a Scaffolding
Safety Posters to be Setup Near Scaffolding

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: Behavioral Skills of a Supervisor When Supervising Scaffolding-Related Work

A scaffolding is a temporary elevated platform that supports workmen, materials or both during the construction or repair of large structures.

When supervising scaffolding-related work, a Supervisor must demonstrate certain behavioural skills, such as motivating his labourers, providing adequate food, snacks and water, building a team, and identifying and selecting labourers for scaffolding related activities.
This topic covers the behavioural skills of a Supervisor during the erection and usage of a scaffolding.

A Supervisor can deliver a quick and short talk to his labourers prior to the start of a work. The purpose of this talk can be to motivate labourers, spread awareness, overcome carelessness, maintain focus, deliver output and so on. You refer to this talk as a pep talk.

During a pep talk, emphasis must be on:

•Strategizing the execution of work

•Meeting the deadlines

•Raising a concern or a risk

•Briefing about a new solution or technique

•Updating on action items and pending work

•Planning for any unforeseen safety or health hazard

A Supervisor can conduct a discussion with his labourers about a specific safety issue. During this discussion, he can explain and demonstrate the use of tools that can ensure safety of his labourers. These discussions can be quick and act as instant training sessions. Both the Supervisor and his labourers can communicate in a timely manner and collaborate over a specific safety concern. You refer to this discussion as a toolbox talk. Usually these discussions are conducted at the start of a shift, during a lunch or snacks break, or during a formal meeting.

A Supervisor must ensure proper supply of food, snacks and water during the erection, usage and dismantling of a scaffolding. Food, water and snacks must be healthy and hygienic. Dedicated locations must be set up for providing or consuming food, snacks and water.

As a Supervisor, you must ear mark these locations and set the appropriate time for consuming food and snacks. You must also ensure labourers do not carry food to the place of work. In addition, food and water must be adequately available and neatly supplied.

To collect left over food, food packets, plates and water cups, you must set up containers or bins. Spillage of water or food must be cleaned immediately.
